definition: to manage the household/to be the one in charge of the family/to call the shots/to be in charge
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
(onom.) dong/ding dong (bell)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]
to be in charge in one's own house (idiom)/to be the master of one's own affairs
a person who doesn't manage a household would not be aware how expensive it is (idiom)
pinyin: bu4 dang1 jia1 bu4 zhi1 chai2 mi3 gui4

sentences.english: The people are the masters of their country.
It is the striking theme of the ruling history and country history that people are the masters.
sentences.chinese: 人民当家作主成为党的执政史和国史的鲜明主题。

sentences.english: When her husband was out she wore the trousers.
sentences.chinese: 当她丈夫不在时，她当家做主。

sentences.english: I will raise you ten because it is Home Alone.
sentences.chinese: 我加十块，我猜是小鬼当家。

sentences.english: The force at the core leading our cause forward is the Chinese Communist Party.
sentences.chinese: 领导我们事业的核心力量是中国当家的。

sentences.english: It was a comedy called "Home Alone".
sentences.chinese: 这是一部叫《小鬼当家》的喜剧。

sentences.english: In in out out one handle, the poor family's child can get marry earlier.
sentences.chinese: 里里外外一把手，穷人的孩子早当家。

sentences.english: Today, Chinese cabbage is no longer the main dish for northern people in winter.
sentences.chinese: 如今，大白菜不再是北方人冬天的当家菜。

sentences.english: There's no doubt who wears the trousers in that household.
sentences.chinese: 那户人家里谁当家是毫无疑问的。

sentences.english: Granite is our shops' main business.
sentences.chinese: 花岗岩是本店经营的当家品种。

sentences.english: He couldn't visualize either Martinez or Brown as platoon sergeant.
sentences.chinese: 他不信马丁内兹和布朗有谁能当得了排里的当家上士。

sentences.english: I am honored to be the host of kids club.
sentences.chinese: 我很荣幸被选为小鬼当家的主持人。

sentences.english: That poor children as early as it headed.
sentences.chinese: 都说穷人的孩子早当家吧。

sentences.english: The bonus told the five children with people outside the door to protect the big headed.
sentences.chinese: 花红告诉小五子带着人去门外面保护大当家。

sentences.english: Ma Po's bean curd is a specialty in our restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 本店的当家菜是麻婆豆腐。

sentences.english: But they say that Mrs. Smith wears the pants in the house.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们说史密斯太太当家掌权。

definition: master (i.e. employer)/landlord/boss
tablet announcing the name of leading actor in a theatrical production/by extension, the lead role
old age/very/eldest child in a family/leader of a group/boss/captain of a boat/leader of a criminal gang
wind direction/the way the wind blows/fig. trend/direction of events/how things develop (esp. how they affect oneself)/public opinion (concerning one's actions)/publicity (usually derog.)/limelight
senior figure/elder/doyen
trump card
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
to be unwilling to pass on one's responsibilities to others
commander-in-chief (military)/star player (sports)/key figure (in an organization)
backbone/mainstay/pillar/definite view/one's own judgment
pillar/backbone
to replace
a general or admiral
to play a leading role/to bear a heavy responsibility
great family/rich family/large landlord/conspicuous spender or consumer
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
